sentences.english: The past is a good place to visit, but certainly not a good place to stay.
sentences.chinese: 过去，是我们偶尔到访的好去处，但显然不宜长留。

sentences.english: Serendipitous people are more fearless about trying something new.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔人们会更加勇于尝试新鲜事物。

sentences.english: Decide that friction will occasionally emerge in the course of human relationships, Stieber says.
sentences.chinese: 在人际交往中一定会偶尔出现摩擦，对这点要肯定。

sentences.english: He dozes in English class once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 他偶尔在英文课打瞌睡。

sentences.english: I can rebound and I can score occasionally.
sentences.chinese: 我偶尔能够抢到篮板球或投篮得分。

sentences.english: Occasionally, a wisp gusts of wind from the garment place slip in company with my arms.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔，几缕瑟瑟的风从衣摆处溜进来与我的双臂为伴。

sentences.english: It will diminish the negative self-talk you may sometimes experience.
sentences.chinese: 它会抵制你偶尔出现的消极的自我暗示。

sentences.english: McGonagall occasionally shows her softer side.
sentences.chinese: 麦格偶尔显示出她温和的一面。

sentences.english: Occasionally, there are 3,322 young people running pass.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔也有三三两两跑步的年轻人擦肩而过。

sentences.english: Not even the most dedicated person is immune to the temptation of occasional chitchat.
sentences.chinese: 即使是最专注的人也禁不起偶尔聊天的诱惑。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, occasionally his eyes trick him.
sentences.chinese: 不过，偶尔他的眼睛也会欺骗他。

sentences.english: The competent person who blunders, this is the person that I love.
sentences.chinese: 有能力的人，偶尔出丑，大爱啊。

sentences.english: Except the tendency to squeeze others on their throat occasionally, he is a good-tempered guy.
sentences.chinese: 除了偶尔掐人脖子之外，他还算是个好脾气的家伙。

sentences.english: Occasionally heard "creak" A snow pressure to cut off the branches.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔会传来“咯吱”一声，积雪把树枝压断了。

sentences.english: I don't have a lighter because I only happen to smoke O. P. B.
sentences.chinese: 我没有打火机，因为我只是偶尔抽他人的香烟。

sentences.english: Once in a while, we tend to indulge in sheer luxury.
sentences.chinese: 我们偶尔会沉溺于那些纯粹的奢侈品。

definition: from time to time/now and then/occasionally/frequently
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
